data.name: lblVideoConvertTips.Text
data.value: Video convert options is only available for host account (super user). Please login with host account if you want to change them.

data.name: plA3Bucket.Help
data.value: If you choose store file via Amazon S3, enter a bucket which will store files.

data.name: lblPermissionCheckDeny.Text
data.value: Video convert permission check failed, please contact your hosting provider.

data.name: lblPermissionCheckOk.Text
data.value: Video convert permission check ok, congratulation!

data.name: plPostWatermark.Help
data.value: Check this option to post a watermark to videos.

data.name: plA3AccessKey.Help
data.value: If you choose store file via Amazon S3, enter access key of your account.

data.name: plVideoConvert_Type.Help
data.value: Select video format which will be converted. Default is flash video (.flv).H.264 (.mp4) offers better quality but it also consume more cpu resources while converting, its size also big than .flv format.

data.name: plA3SecretKey.Help
data.value: If you choose store file via Amazon S3, enter secret key of your account.

data.name: plGenerateThumb.Help
data.value: If this option is checked, module will automatic generate thubmnail image if necessary. For example, if product image is Cpu.jpg, then module will generate a thunbmail named thumb_Cpu.jpg. It will improve performance greatly while displaying images in list.

data.name: plThumbnailSize.Help
data.value: Enter thumbnail image size to be generated.

data.name: plFileStorage.Help
data.value: Choose user file storage. For small and medium sites, store files under portal root is enough. However, if you have large amout files to handle, then store them via Amazon Simple Storage Services (Amazon S3) will be a better solution. Check http://aws.amazon.com/s3/ for more details.

data.name: plPermissionCheck.Help
data.value: To convert videos, web server must give execute permission to DesktopModules\CrossClassified\Exe folder (or its parent folder). Contact your hosting provider if you can't pass video convert permission check. For more details, please see "Help - video convert permission" section in Cp_Admin sub module.

data.name: plVideoConvert.Help
data.value: Check this option to convert user upload videos to .flv or h264 (.mp4) format. Note, you must pass the "permission check" to convert videos successfully.

data.name: plVideoConvert_Width.Help
data.value: Choose video width which will be converted. If source video width is small than this value, video will keep its own width after convert. If source video width is bigger than this value, its width will changed after convert. Default value is 480, this is the H.264 video format width of YouTube.com. Choose "use existing video width" option will not change source video width.

data.name: plWatermark.Help
data.value: Select a watermark file (.gif) which will be posted to videos.

data.name: plUseSeoFriendlyUrl.Help
data.value: If this option is checked, module will generate item detail url using item name. For example, if a product name is Cross Product 5.5, then its detail url will be like http://www.youdomainname.com/tabid/453/articleid/232/Cross-Product-5-5.aspx. This will improve seo friendly. We recommend customers check this option if your information is written by English. However, for other language like Chinese, it is better to turn this option off.

data.name: A3AuthFailed.Text
data.value: Please check your Amazon A3 access key, secrect key and bucket name, make sure they are correct.

data.name: plProcessExitTime.Help
data.value: Video convert process time limit (millisecond). If convert time exceed value, process will terminate and your video will not continue to convert. Default value is 1800000 (30 minutes), this value will let you convert a video which size bigger than 1G in normal computer. Increase this value if you want to handle very big videos (e.g. dvd files more than 10g). Decrease this value if you don't want user upload big videos.

data.name: plModulePage_Help.Help
data.value: If you provide help information to users (for example, explain term of use/offer faqs, etc), specify its page here. When user click the "help" button in "Cp_Product_AccountLink" module, (or click the "help" button in skin object), module will navigate to this page.

data.name: plUserFolderRoot.Help
data.value: Enter folder root which store user upload files. Default value is "CrossClassified", means that user upload files will store under portals/[portalID]/CrossClassified folder. You can change them to meet you needs. For example, if you also use our Cross Article module, you can change it as "CrossArticle" so Classified Pro will use the same folder root as Cross Article module.

data.name: Tip_HelpPage.Text
data.value: If you provide help information to users (for example, explain term of use/offer faqs, etc), specify its page here. When user click the "help" button in "Cp_Product_AccountLink" sub module, (or click the "help" button in skin object), module will navigate to this page. For live demo, please visit http://DnnModule.com.

data.name: Tip_SeoUrl.Text
data.value: If this option is checked, module will generate item detail url using item name. For example, if a product name is Cross Product 5.5, then its detail url will be like http://www.youdomainname.com/tabid/453/productid/232/Cross-Product-5-5.aspx. This will improve SEO friendly. We recommend customers to check on this option if your information is written by English. However, for other language like Chinese, it is better to turn this option off.

data.name: Tip_A3.Text
data.value: To store files on Amazon S3, you must provide below information: Access key, Secret Key and S3 bucket.

data.name: Tip_UserFolderRoot.Text
data.value: Enter folder root which stores user upload files. Default value is "CrossClassified", means that user upload files will be stored under portals/[PortalID]/CrossClassified/[UserID] folder. You can change it to meet you needs. For example, if you also use our Cross Video Gallery module, you can change it as "CrossUserFile" so Classified Pro module will use the same folder root as Cross Video Gallery module.

data.name: Tip_GenerateThumb.Text
data.value: If this option is checked, module will automatic generate thubmnail image if necessary. For example, if product image is Cpu.jpg, then module will generate a thunbmail named thumb_Cpu.jpg. It will improve performance greatly while displaying images in list.

data.name: plDnnSitemap.Help
data.value: Check on this option to integrate with DNN built-in web sitemap.

data.name: plDnnSitemap.Text
data.value: Integrate with DNN built-in web sitemap

data.name: Tip_DnnSitemapIntegration.Text
data.value:
As we know, DNN provides a web sitemap file which can be submitted to Google webmaster tools to let Google index your site more easily. You can configure your web sitemap url by click DNN standard menu "Admin - Search engine sitemap". It is a great way to improve your site seo.

  By default, DNN only lists your web pages as sitemap urls. However, you can check on below option to let Classified Pro also includes your product urls in web sitemap urls. It is a must do action if you want to your products be searched more easily.

  We strongly reommend you check on "Integrate with DNN built-in web sitemap" option and submit your web sitemap to Google. Note, if you don't find your product url in your site map urls, you need to delete Portals/[Portal ID]/Sitemap/sitemap.xml file first to clear existing cache.

  You can follow below steps to submit your web sitemap.

  1. Before you begin, make sure you have the your site added and verified in your Webmaster Tools account.

  2. On the Webmaster Tools home page, click your site.

  3. Under Site configuration, click Sitemaps.

  4. Click "Submit a Sitemap".

  5. In the text box, copy your web sitemap url below and click "Submit Sitemap".

  6. Note, you need to uncheck this option first if you want to uninstall Classified Pro package.

data.name: plGoogleMapApi.Help
data.value: To integrate Google maps with your products, you need to provide a api key. Classified Pro module already create a key for you. If you want to use your own, you can sign up a new key at https://code.google.com/apis/console and enter it. Check https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/tutorial for more details.

data.name: Tip_GoogleMapApi.Text
data.value: To integrate Google maps with your products, you need to provide a api key. Classified Pro already created a key for you to test it. We strongly recommend you to sing up your own api key at https://code.google.com/apis/console and enter it. Check https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/tutorial for more details.

data.name: AuthFailed_WatermarkImage.Text
data.value: Please provide a valid .gif image as watermark file, or uncheck the "Add Watermark" option.

data.name: plAddWatermark.Help
data.value: Control whether to add watermark to user uploaded photos. The watermark can be a text, or a small image (.gif file).

data.name: plTextFontBgColor.Help
data.value: Watermakr text background color, default is #000000

data.name: plTextFontFamily.Help
data.value: Text font family, default is "Arial". You can change to other font family, but make sure it is a valid font.

data.name: plWatermarkImage.Help
data.value: Choose a .gif file as watermark image.

data.name: plWatermarkPosition.Help
data.value: Watermark Position, can be put on top left/top right/bottom left/bottom right.

data.name: plWatermarkType.Help
data.value: The watermark can be a text, or a small image (.gif file).

data.name: Tip_Watermark.Text
data.value:
Control whether to add watermark to user upload photos. The watermark can be a text, or a small image (.gif file). Please note:

    1. Module will try to optimize photo after add watermark. In most cases, this process will keep same photo quality but will reduce photo size.

    2. If you want to generate watermark based gif image, please make sure it is not a animation file. We also recommend you to choose a gif image which has transparent background.

    3. See below sample images as a reference.

data.name: plShowCopyright.Help
data.value: Select this to add the Classified Pro module copyright credits to the Page Source.

data.name: plJournalTypeId.Help
data.value: By default, product journal will be added under "articleadd" type, you can change it to other type if needed.

data.name: plJournal_Enabled.Help
data.value: Check to integrate with DNN built-in journal.

data.name: secJournal.Text
data.value: Integrate with DNN built-in journal & Social Share

data.name: Tip_JournalIntegration.Text
data.value:
Check on below options to integrate with DNN built-in journal. When a user posts an product/comment, module will automatic adds a record to his journals.

    By default, product journal will be added under "product" type, you can change it to other type if necessary.

data.name: plShowSettingActionButton.Help
data.value: Show setting button in other 15 sub modules, this is useful if you are not familiar with Classified Pro module.

data.name: plShowSettingActionButton.Text
data.value: Show Setting Button Shortcut In Sub Modules

data.name: plLayoutContent.Help
data.value: Choose layout content of current Cp_Admin sub module instance

data.name: plHideAllTips.Help
data.value: To help user using Classified Pro, we have put a lot of tips on the module interface. These tips are very useful for beginners to be familiar with Classified Pro but they look cumbersome sometimes. If you are already familiar with Classified Pro, you can check on below option, to hide all these tips. Caution: be very careful to check on this option.

data.name: plTabStyle.Help
data.value: Choose tab css style in the Cp_Admin sub module.

data.name: Tip_HideAllTips.Text
data.value: To help user using Classified Pro, we have put a lot of tips on the module interface. These tips are very useful for beginners to be familiar with Classified Pro but they look cumbersome sometimes. If you are already familiar with Classified Pro, you can check on below option, to hide all these tips. <font color="red">Caution:</font> be very careful to check on this option.

data.name: Tip_TabStyle.Text
data.value: Jquery tab is used everywhere in the Cp_Admin sub module. For example, when you edit items at "Cp_Admin sub module - Seller Center - My Auction Listings", you will see data is organized with JQuery tab. Classified Pro provides <font color="red">24</font> css styles (locates under DesktopModules/CrossClassified/css/jquery-ui-themes-1.11.4/themes folder) for these tabs, here you can choose your favorite one.

data.name: Tip_AdSocialShare.Text
data.value: When posting classified ads (like news article, job listing, house rent, etc), author (seller) can mark ad as public / protected, or only viewable between his friends / followers / social groups. If you don't need this feature, uncheck below option.

data.name: plEnableSilverlightUpload.Help
data.value: Classified Pro provides two file upload controls - the normal javascript based upload control and the MS Silverlight plug-in based file upload control. If you don't like the MS Silverlight file upload control, uncheck this option to hide it.
